figures.description:
Table content: This is a graph that has 20 sample runs of what it could look like if you
are a 3bb/100 (estimated) winner in the same game. Notice all samples
have made money, and a good amount at that! The difference in variance
is staggering between a marginal winner and a strong winner. The strong
winner is pretty much guaranteed money at the end of the year, while the

marginal winner is much more likely to go broke and be forced to quit

Table content: This is a graph that has 20 sample runs of what it could look like if
you are a 1bb/100 (estimated) winner in a game with 80bb/100 standard
deviation - most NLHE 6-max players/games. Over 1,000,000 hands (you
could feasibly play this many hands in a year), about 10% of 1bb/100
winners are still down. This is a bit scary if you are trying to make a living

playing poker and are only a small winner.
